definitions.definition: To admit to fellowship, enter into fellowship with; to make feel welcome by showing friendship or building a cordial relationship. Now only in religious use.
examples: The Bishop's family fellowshipped the new converts.
The Society of Religious Snobs refused to fellowship the poor family.

definitions.definition: To join in fellowship; to associate with.
examples: The megachurch he attends is too big for making personal connections, so he also fellowships weekly in one of the church's small groups.
After she got married, she stopped fellowshipping with the singles in our church.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , now chiefly religious , especially in Canada , US

main_definition: ( transitive ) To admit to fellowship, enter into fellowship with; to make feel welcome by showing friendship or building a cordial relationship. Now only in religious use.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , now chiefly religious , especially in Canada , US ) To join in fellowship; to associate with.
